channel.title: #172: Getting rid of Google Analytics, with Alex Yumashev
channel.description:
<iframe height="200px" width="100%" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" seamless src="https://player.simplecast.com/5780cf25-163b-42a8-8c7e-98f5d6a36838?dark=false"></iframe>
Alex Yumashev (@jitbit), founder of [JitBit](https://www.jitbit.com/), returns to the show. We discuss:
* why Alex ditched Google Analytics from his website * how he keeps his work interesting after so many years running the same business * why differentiation is often not possible * finding freelancers * the good and bad of being a bootstrapping entrepreneur
Also mentioned:
* [Plausible Analytics](https://plausible.io/) * [f5bot.com](https://f5bot.com/)
This [episode is also on YouTube](https://youtu.be/23m-gUJVv6w).
[You can also download, listen and subscribe to this episode here](https://bootstrapped.fm/172-getting-rid-of-google-analytics-with-alex-yumashev/).

item.title: #172: Getting rid of Google Analytics, with Alex Yumashev
item.dc:creator: unboot
item.description:
Regarding SaaS admin interfaces: RoR has a nice collection of nearly ready made admin interfaces: Category: Rails Admin Interfaces - The Ruby Toolbox . I use something similar for my tech stack. My recommendation is to try first with a copy of your production db, and if you deploy it to set up the admin interface in a separate app behind a firewall.

Read full topic
